meanings.definition: To take back or regain possession of something.
meanings.sent1: She reassumed her lost necklace after finding it under the bed.
meanings.sent2: He reassumed his jacket before heading out into the cold.
meanings.sent3: The cat reassumed its favorite spot on the windowsill after the dog left.
meanings.sent4: The sun reassumed its place in the sky after the storm passed.
meanings.sent5: The detective reassumed control of the crime scene to continue the investigation.

meanings.definition: To resume a previous position or role.
meanings.sent1: After a short break, she reassumed her seat at the front of the class.
meanings.sent2: He reassumed his duties as team captain after recovering from his injury.
meanings.sent3: The actor reassumed his role as the villain in the sequel to the movie.
meanings.sent4: The old clock reassumed its ticking rhythm after being repaired.
meanings.sent5: The teacher reassumed her role as the leader of the classroom after the substitute left.
